text: hey everybody thomas joseph here and
today we are tackling a popular
conundrum and that is the dutch baby and
now have many of you out there stopped
short of making this impressive
breakfast treat because it seems so
intimidating well it's actually really
easy only a few ingredients and you know
what it's delicious and impressive so
let's get started
[Music]
all right a Dutch baby it is four
ingredients for the most part flour
butter milk and eggs that's all you need
to make this wonderful impressive
pancake now there's a little bit of salt
and if you wanted some spice you could
certainly do that as well but it's
really just those four ingredients now I
have a mixing bowl here and to that I'm
going to add a half a cup of whole milk
and all you need is whole milk
you don't need heavy cream you don't
need any buttermilk or anything like
that so simple whole milk
I'm gonna add two eggs now the eggs are
the main leavening here that's gonna
give you this wonderful puffy pancake
and if you're not sure what a Dutch baby
is it's basically like a large-format
popover or if you know what a Yorkshire
pudding is it's basically the same thing
except it doesn't have all of that beef
fat that wonderful flavor that goes
along with it so I'm gonna start my pan
here this is where tablespoons of
unsalted butter and this is in 8 inch
skillet now you could use a cast-iron
skillet you could use just a standard
stainless steel skillet like I have here
it will puff up nicely in any vessel you
just want to make sure that you're using
the right size for this recipe nothing
too big otherwise it's not going to be
as impressive and voluminous
so that's melting and I'm gonna finish
my batter up here I'm gonna whisk the
eggs and the milk together I'm gonna add
1/3 of a cup of standard all-purpose
flour and one thing you don't really
need to be worried about here guys is
any lumps so don't over whisk this
batter you don't want to whisk it too
much where you don't see any of those
lumps they're gonna work their way out
of the batter during the cooking process
so if there are lumps don't be worried
just don't over mix this guy so that
looks pretty good now I'm gonna add a
little bit of seasoning so coarse kosher
salt and then I'm using nutmeg today but
you could use whatever you'd like to
flavor this if you wanted to add a
little bit of vanilla that would be
really fantastic you could add a little
bit of lemon zest some ground cinnamon
if that's what you liked or you could
just leave the spice out completely it's
totally up to you
so the butter is nice and melted just
swirl it around the pan a little bit so
it comes up the side and now take your
super simple batter pour it right into
the skillet now make sure you have an
oven preheated to 425 degrees with the
rack in the middle of the oven and you
want to make sure that there isn't a
rack that's above it because this is
gonna puff up nicely in the oven and you
want to make sure that it has plenty of
room to grow so I'm gonna turn the heat
off and go right into that 425 degree
oven this will take anywhere from 15 to
20 minutes all right guys the Dutch baby
has been in the oven for about 20
minutes now you want to make sure when
it's in the oven don't open the door
allow this to kind of grow up the side
of the pan undisturbed almost like a
souffle and it will reach its maximum
potential and create a nice crisp crust
now when it comes out of the oven a
little bit of confectioner's sugar over
the top because this doesn't really have
any sugar in the batter you can serve
this with so many different things you
can give it a little bit of a squeeze
lemon that's really great to kind of
offset all of that richness from the
butter I like to serve with some
macerated berries any fruits that are in
season or you could really just serve
this with your favorite jam or jelly so
I hope I've inspired you to make this
delicious breakfast brunch treat at home
it's really simple to make it's not
intimidating at all and if you have any
kitchen conundrums any breakfast
conundrums please do reach out to us
using the hashtag kitchen conundrums we
love to hear from you guys and enjoy
your impressive Dutch babies and as
always guys click like and subscribe
